page.title: 04Transport around Rivenhall
page.content: Vehicles using roads in Britain are of mainly six types,these being cars, vans, lorries, motorcycles, buses and bicycles.The roads in the area around Rivenhall range from very small minor roads,which have very little traffic on them,up to a major road,the A12.We have no motorways in this area.A survey of vehicles using a local B-road and the A12 showed that during a working day an average of 160 vehicles used the B-road and 1280 vehicles used the A12. A mainline railway passes through this area going from London to Norwich or Clacton.There is also a branch line from Witham to Braintree.The trains are both diesel and electric and carry both passengers and goods.During a working day in excess of two hundred trains travel along the main railway line.
